permissions: Admins can create liability incidents. Non-admins can create incidents only when authorized for the subject: JobProductionPlan (subject policy create), TenderJobScheduleShift (job production plan create), Customer/Trucker/Developer/Contractor/MaterialSupplier/MaterialSite (subject update), Broker (practical member), ProjectTransportPlan (subject update).
side_effects: Creates a liability incident and may create or update associated incident unit-of-measure quantities for net impact minutes/dollars.
validation_notes: --subject-type, --subject-id, --start-at, and --status are required. --net-impact-minutes and --net-impact-dollars must be numeric. --natures values must be valid and unique incident natures (personal, property). Status must be one of open/closed/abandoned/processing/parked. Kind must be one of accident_notification_and_assistance/damage/theft/vandalism/vehicle_incident. Severity must be one of low/medium/high/catastrophic. --did-stop-work must not be set for liability incidents. --subject-type must map to a valid subject type (JobProductionPlan, TenderJobScheduleShift, Broker, Customer, Trucker, Developer, Contractor, MaterialSupplier, MaterialSite, ProjectTransportPlan). --end-at must be after --start-at and is required when status is closed. If --equipment is set, --job-production-plan must be set and the equipment must belong to the job production plan. If --tender-job-schedule-shift and --job-production-plan are both set, they must reference the same job production plan. --tender-job-schedule-shift must be a broker shift. If --assignee is set, the user must have a relationship with the customer and be in scope for the subject. If --parent-id is set without --parent-type, the parent type defaults to liability-incidents.

flags.name: --did-stop-work
flags.description: Did stop work (not valid for liability incidents)
flags.validation: Must not be set for liability incidents

flags.name: --end-at
flags.validation: ISO 8601 timestamp; must be after start-at; required when status is closed

flags.name: --equipment
flags.validation: Requires job-production-plan; equipment must belong to that plan

flags.name: --kind
flags.validation: One of accident_notification_and_assistance, damage, theft, vandalism, vehicle_incident

flags.name: --natures
flags.validation: Values must be unique and in: personal, property

flags.name: --parent-type
flags.validation: Defaults to liability-incidents when parent-id is set

flags.name: --severity
flags.validation: One of low, medium, high, catastrophic

flags.name: --status
flags.validation: One of open, closed, abandoned, processing, parked

flags.name: --subject-type
flags.validation: Must map to a valid subject type

flags.name: --tender-job-schedule-shift
flags.validation: Must be a broker shift; must relate to job-production-plan when both set
